reviews.review_msg: Simon does his best but the lack of slides/extra resources makes it feel like he wings the lectures and causes lectures to be all over the place. i left most lectures feeling like i just sat through 3 hours of the missile knows where it is meme. opaque grading, esp. participation, feels like is chosen to curve the grades more than anything

Nitpicky marker, condescending when students ask questions, went on tangents in class which made even the simplest material seem confusing, disorganized syllabus and assignments, and gave zero directive on the "midterm" (which was the second to last class, meaning we had to study every reading ever assigned to us to prepare). Avoid her at all costs

Jillian is by far the worst Phil prof I have had at SFU. The lectures are disorganized and confusing and her condescending responses are totally uncalled for. I could have studied until the cows came home and it wouldn't have made a difference. Extremely hard material with terrible lectures and an impossible hard midterm. GPA killer.

Try to avoid! This was one class that I was really looking forward to, but I was really disappointed. Her lectures are really boring, and hard to comprehend. She does not give any direction on what she is looking for in assignments and then rips your paper apart (with comments) when she returns it.
